News and Blog

  • 18 January 2018

    Congratulations to James for winning a 2018 Facebook Fellowship!

  • 16 January 2018

    Liang, Tianqi, Thierry, Eddie, and Haichen had their Parameter Hub and TVM papers accepted to SysML! Nice job guys!

  • 11 January 2018

    Ming and Liang had their ASPLOS 2017 paper on in-network computing selected for Micro Top Picks.

  • 16 November 2017

    Two of our projects won runner up for the Madrona Prize! Congrats to Amrita, Armin, Luis, and Mark for their work on real-time virtual reality video hardware, and to Thierry and Luis (and our friends in machine learning) for their work on the TVM end-to-end deep learning stack.

  • 10 November 2017

    Sung, Thierry, and Armin‘s paper on cotraining neural networks with voltage overscaling, and Vincent and Armin’s paper on correlation engineering for stochastic computing were both accepted to DATE 2018.

  • 29 August 2017

    Amrita, Thierry, Sung, Meghan, and Armin have a great new paper on hardware-accelerated camera processing pipelines at IISWC (in Seattle!) this September.

  • 11 July 2017

    Amrita and Armin‘s paper on hardware-accelerated virtual reality video, in collaboration with Google, was accepted to High-Performance Graphics!

  • 09 June 2017

    Congratulations to Max and Vincent for winning a 2017 Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship for their project on domain-specific reconfigurable accelerators! This is Vincent’s second QIF win.

  • 02 March 2017

    Eddie‘s paper on gaming skill development appeared in Topics in Cognitive Science.

  • 17 November 2016

    Ming, Liang and Djordje just had papers accepted to ASPLOS'17 on in-network computing and applying approximate computing ideas to video storage! And Vincent and Armin had a paper on stochastic neural networks accepted to DATE'17! Woohoo!

  • 29 July 2016

    Brandon, James and Irene just had a paper on applying approximate computing ideas to distributed systems accepted to SOCC 2016!

  • 18 May 2016

    Karin is featured as one of Fast Company’s “100 Most Creative People in Business 2016”.

  • 07 May 2016

    Adrian, who will soon join the faculty at Cornell, won UW CSE’s William Chan Memorial Dissertation Award for his work on approximate computing.

  • 03 April 2016

    We just ran a Workshop on Approximate Computing (WAX) w/ ASPLOS. It was a smashing success again!

  • 04 December 2015

    Luis and Karin appear in the New York Times today discussing our work on DNA storage.

  • 17 November 2015

    We have three papers accepted to ASPLOS 2016! Luis and Karin on approximate storage; James, Luis, and Karin on DNA-based storage; and James, Emina, and Xi on file system crash-consistency.

  • 27 October 2015

    We’re incredibly proud of our own Professor Luis Ceze, who was recognized by his alma mater with UIUC CS’s Distinguished Educator Alumni Award.

  • 07 October 2015

    Carlo and Vincent just went to MEMSYS to present our paper on a new memory for content-based search! Cool stuff!

  • 05 October 2015

    Sampa’s going formal: congrats to James, Emina, Dan, and Luis on their paper, Optimizing Synthesis with Metasketches, being accepted to POPL 2016! This is Luis’s first foray into POPL, but don’t worry, the paper still has plenty of plots.

  • 08 July 2015

    The core Grappa paper just won Best Paper at USENIX ATC! Congratulations to the team!

  • 18 June 2015

    We just received a new large NSF grant to explore approximate computing across the system stack. We will make great use of it!

  • 16 June 2015

    At PLDI this week, our very own Professor Dan Grossman received the SIGPLAN Distinguished Service Award for services to the programming languages community. Huge congratulations, Dan!

  • 13 June 2015

    We just ran a Workshop on Approximate Computing (WAX) w/ FCRC. It was a smashing success!

  • 12 June 2015

    Adrian successfully defended his thesis and will join the faculty at Cornell University after a year at MSR. Congratulations, Adrian!! We are all very proud!

  • 13 April 2015

    The team of Vincent and Carlo won a 2015 Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship for their project on large-scale search!

  • 02 April 2015

    Congratulations to Carlo on winning the NSF fellowship!

  • 28 February 2015

    We’re helping plan WAX, another iteration of the workshop on approximate computing. Check out the call for participation and submit something great!

  • 10 February 2015

    Check out the SNNAP page, and sign up for updates as we are working on open-sourcing our design. The paper will be presented at HPCA this week!

  • 12 November 2014

    Congratulations to Brandon Lucia on his CGO paper on data provenance in multithreaded programs (the last chapter of his thesis); to Thierry, Mark Wyse, Adrian and Jacob on their HPCA paper on FPGA-based neural acceleration; and to Mike Ringenburg and Adrian on their ASPLOS paper on debugging and monitoring quality in approximate programs! Great news!!

  • 22 October 2014

    Check out the documentation and code for ACCEPT, our approximate compiler framework.

  • 15 October 2014

    Check out our poster on Grappa, which was presented at OSDI last week. And consider downloading the code and trying it out!

  • 14 October 2014

    Brandon Lucia, one of our proud alumni, is moving to CMU as an assistant professor! Congratulations, Brandon!

  • 06 July 2014

    We have three fantastic additions to the group! Welcome to the Sampa group, James Bornholt, Amrita Mazumdar, and Carlo Del Mundo!

  • 01 June 2014

    Our group will have two papers appear in OOPSLA 2014! One on locality analysis for global-address-space parallel code and one on symbolic execution for multithreaded programs. Great stuff, congratulations, Tom B, and Brandon H!

  • 01 May 2014

    Tom Bergan and Mike Ringenburg have recently finished their PhDs! Mike is now an Architect at Cray, and Tom will join Google Seattle in the Fall. Congratulations to both!

  • 06 March 2014

    Our paper on analog neural networks for approximate computing was accepted to ISCA'14. Great collaboration with GATech, UT Austin and MSR!

  • 06 March 2014

    We just released our Grappa runtime system for large-scale irregular applications. Give it a try!

  • 03 March 2014

    WACAS 2014 was the largest workshop at ASPLOS! Papers and (most) slides are now online at the workshop webpage.

  • 16 February 2014

    Our paper on probabilistic assertions was accepted to PLDI 2014.

  • 07 December 2013

    We’re organizing a workshop on approximate computing! WACAS 2014 will be co-located with ASPLOS.

  • 01 November 2013

    We have two papers in ASPLOS'14: one on mapping low-level races to language-level races and one on fully-integrated 3D-stacked key-value stores.
